alert.note: Alert for Cayuga; Cortland; Madison; Oneida; Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 9:44AM EST until January 14 at 10:15AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... West central Oneida County in central New York... Northwestern Madison County in central New York... Southeastern Cayuga County in central New York... Northwestern Cortland County in central New York... Southern Onondaga County in central New York... * Until 1015 AM EST. * At 944 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Bridgeport to Genoa, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. Locations impacted include... Onondaga, Syracuse, Rome, De Witt, Sullivan, Pompey, Vienna, Chittenango, Canastota, and Manlius. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 34A and 35. New York Interstate 81 between 13 and 22. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
